content: If a car travels at a constant speed of 60 miles per hour, how long will it take to travel 240 miles?

If a car is moving at a steady speed of 60 miles per hour, to find out how long it would take to cover a distance of 240 miles, you can use the formula:

Time = Distance / Speed

So, plugging in the values:

Time = 240 miles / 60 miles per hour = 4 hours

Therefore, it would take 4 hours for the car to travel 240 miles at a constant speed of 60 miles per hour.
